msContents.summary: Private letter from Psimouras to Chairemon about greetings and conveyance of goods

msItem.note: Almost complete and written across the fibers; on the front remains of an account in a neat small hand and one line containing the address
11 lines of writing, plus one on the front in a small clear hand which is slightly uneven
Nikephoros, a donkey-driver who may have been a slave, appears to have been branded

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Hessein Abdel Salam in Cairo on December 14, 1926 through H.I. Bell; no. 14 in Bell's inventory

div.ab: Psimouras to Chairemon his brother, greetings. Receive through Nikephoros the branded (?) donkey-driver a basket of grapes which was the only one they were able to carry. Let me know if you received what I sent you through my donkey-driver and what I had sent to you through Anoubas the camel-driver. Greet the excellent Tete(. .)s and her mother and all your people. Let me know what you need. The children greet you. I pray for your health. Mecheir 29. Front: To Chairemon from Psimouras.

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. X 253 Plate 6 in P.Col. X; published by L. Jones, BASP 24 (1987) 17-21, with plate on p. 19
